about.description:
PyOpenCL lets you access GPUs, multi-core CPUs, and other massively
parallel compute devices from Python, through the OpenCL parallel
compute interface.

name: pyopencl
raw_recipe:
{% set name = "pyopencl" %}
{% set version = "2016.2" %}
{% set sha256 = "1b94540cf59ea71a3ef234a8f1d0eb2b4633c112f0f554fb69e52b4a0337d82b" %}

package:
    name: {{ name|lower }}
    version: {{ version }}

source:
    fn: {{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
    url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
    sha256: {{ sha256 }}

build:
    number: 1

requirements:
    build:
        - python
        - setuptools
        - cffi
        - numpy
        - ocl-icd  # [linux]
        - khronos-opencl-icd-loader  # [win]
        - mingwpy  # [win]
    run:
        - python
        - numpy
        - pytools
        - six
        - mako
        - cffi
        - appdirs
        - khronos-opencl-icd-loader  # [win]
        - ocl-icd  # [linux]

test:
    requires:
        - pytest
    imports:
        - {{ name }}
    commands:
        # Will be able to test on linux as soon as pocl is packaged.
        - cd $SRC_DIR/test && python -m pytest  # [osx]

about:
    home: http://pypi.python.org/pypi/pyopencl
    doc_url: https://documen.tician.de/pyopencl
    dev_url: http://github.com/inducer/pyopencl
    license: MIT
    license_file: LICENSE
    summary: Python wrapper for OpenCL
    description: |

        PyOpenCL lets you access GPUs, multi-core CPUs, and other massively
        parallel compute devices from Python, through the OpenCL parallel
        compute interface.

extra:
    recipe-maintainers:
        - inducer
